repnme.cdata!:
Mauritania - Education Sector Development
            Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education Sector
            Development Program Project for Mauritania were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was substantial; Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory and borrower performance was also moderately
            unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: special
            agreements with United Nations agencies and other donors
            should be cleared prior to project effectiveness. Project
            implementation units within the ministry are more effective
            than those outside the ministry structure. Community
            participation for school construction is important for
            ensuring low cost school construction and local ownership in
            Mauritania. Joint government and donor annual sector reviews
            are important for ensuring coordination of activities and
            quality implementation in Mauritania. Project preparation
            should include a quality review regardless of institutional
            requirements. Projects must have adequate monitoring
            arrangements in place prior to effectiveness. Submission
            deadline constraints by external financiers can impact the
            quality of project preparation.

repnme.cdata!:
Mauritania - Education Sector Development
            Program Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall the Catalytic Fund (CF) will
            help the Government of Mauritania to accelerate the
            implementation of the Government's Education Sector
            Development Program (ESDP 2001-2015) in its entirety.
            Activities financed by the CF are within the ESDP's
            plan of action over the period 2008-2010.  The project has
            made significant progress and is poised to achieve a 100
            percent disbursement of grant proceeds through the six month
            extension. However, a few important activities have incurred
            unforeseen delays: a) primary school construction that
            experienced delays due to heavy rain; b) delivery of three
            million textbooks for the three coming school years; and c)
            30,000 student desks. Therefore, an extension of the closing
            date will ensure completion of those activities. The
            additional time will allow the project to finalize
            activities that will support progress towards achieving
            project development objective (PDO) by: 1) creating
            additional spaces for students and thus increasing the total
            number of beneficiaries (including girls): and 2) creating a
            better learning environment that will entice students to
            stay in school by providing additional student desks and textbooks.

            Development Program Project : restructuring : Main report
